Model.name: resource
Model.Doc: This model specifies the elements which make up a Mondrian resource file. See {@link ResourceGenTask} for more information.

Element.Doc: A ResourceBundle is a collection of resources. The resource generator generates a class from a resource bundle which has an accessor method for each resource.

Attribute.name: locale
Attribute.Doc: The locale of resources in this resource bundle, for example, "en_US_Boston", "en_US", or "en".

Attribute.name: cppNamespace
Attribute.Doc: C++ Namespace for generated classes. Base classes are assumed to be in the same namespace.

Attribute.name: cppCommonInclude
Attribute.Doc: C++ common include file. Included at the start of all generated C++ class implementations.

Attribute.name: cppExceptionClassName
Attribute.Doc: Default class for exceptions in generated C++.

Attribute.name: cppExceptionClassLocation
Attribute.Doc: The location of the C++ header file that contains the definition of the defautl C++ exception class. Required if the default C++ exception class is defined. This location is also used as the default location for resource-specific exception classes.

Object.name: code
Object.Doc: Text within this element is included in the generated class.

Attribute.name: name
Attribute.Doc: The name of this message or error, unique within this resource bundle.

Element.Doc: An exception defines a message which is issued in response to some invalid condition. It has a type, which must be derived from {@link Throwable}. The generated newExceptionName method creates an instance of this exception with the appropriate parameters.

Attribute.name: className
Attribute.Doc: The name of the exception class. Must be fully qualified, unless it is in the package java.lang. If not specified, the resource bundle's default exception class is used.

Attribute.name: cppClassName
Attribute.Doc: The name of the C++ exception class. If not specified, the resource bundle's default C++ exception class is used.

Attribute.name: cppClassLocation
Attribute.Doc: The name of the C++ exception class. If not specified, the resource bundle's default C++ exception location is used. One of the two must be specfied if the C++ exception class is given.

Attribute.name: cppChainExceptions
Attribute.Doc: Set to true if the C++ exception classes support being chained together. The default is false. If true, an extra method will be generated for that takes a const pointer to the C++ exception class.
